comments:
20040326 0800

When we try and launch a self hosted workspace with no plug-ins we got the error below

STEPS
1) Start Eclipse with a fresh workspace
2) Go to Java Perspective
3) Select Run-> Run time Workbench

!SESSION Mar 26, 2004 10:55:32.867 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_01
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=en_US
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Mar 26, 2004 10:55:32.876
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Synchronizer
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:277)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:117)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:316)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:725)

Self hosting can be made to work with the following steps.

1)Checkout org.eclipse.swt and org.eclipse.swt.carbon from head
2)Set the java.library.path to include the dll in org.eclipse.swt.carbon
3)Run the runtime workbench with the workspace swt rather than the external one

The console prints the following errors but eclipse still launches properly

Unhandled Exception
Reason:
Unable to execute early startup code for an extension
Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/internal/carbon/OS)
*** SWT nested exception
Reason:
org/eclipse/swt/internal/carbon/OS

This only happens on Jaguar (which we don't have to support any more).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 56037 ***
